description: Полная настраиваемость StyleConfiguration — все захардкоженные значения рендерера управляются через config

userStories.title: Blockquote border toggle
userStories.description: As a developer, I want to disable the blockquote left border via config so that I can style quotes without the vertical line.
acceptanceCriteria: config.blockquote.borderWidth = 0 disables the border overlay (no Rectangle drawn)
config.blockquote.borderWidth = 5 renders 5pts border (existing behavior preserved)
.default config renders 3pts left border (no visual change)
Wrap the overlay in a conditional: only draw when (config.blockquote.borderWidth ?? 3) > 0
Tests pass
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: OL numbering format enum and config field
userStories.description: As a developer, I want to change ordered list numbering format (decimal, alpha, roman, custom) via config instead of writing a custom ViewBuilder.
acceptanceCriteria: Create public enum ListNumberFormat: Sendable with cases: .decimal, .lowerAlpha, .upperAlpha, .lowerRoman, .upperRoman, .custom(@Sendable (Int) -> String)
Add format(_ index: Int) -> String method to ListNumberFormat that returns the formatted marker string with trailing dot (except .custom)
.decimal formats as '1.' '2.' '3.'
.lowerAlpha formats as 'a.' 'b.' 'c.' ... 'z.' 'aa.' 'ab.' ...
.upperAlpha formats as 'A.' 'B.' 'C.' ... 'Z.' 'AA.' ...
.lowerRoman formats as 'i.' 'ii.' 'iii.' 'iv.' 'v.' ... up to at least 50
.upperRoman formats as 'I.' 'II.' 'III.' 'IV.' 'V.' ...
.custom closure receives 0-based index, returns full marker string (user controls the dot/bracket)
Add listNumberFormat field to HTMLStyleConfiguration with default .decimal
renderOrderedList() uses config.listNumberFormat.format(index) instead of hardcoded Text("\(index + 1).")
.default config produces identical output (decimal numbering)
Typecheck and strict concurrency pass
userStories.notes: ListNumberFormat cannot be Equatable/Hashable due to closure case. HTMLStyleConfiguration has no such conformances, so no issue.

userStories.title: kbd uses config.keyboard for padding, border, cornerRadius
userStories.description: As a developer, I want to style <kbd> elements via config.keyboard so that I can change padding, border and cornerRadius without a custom ViewBuilder.
acceptanceCriteria: Rewrite kbd rendering to read config.keyboard values with fallbacks: padding ?? EdgeInsets(top:1,leading:3,bottom:1,trailing:3), cornerRadius ?? 3, borderColor ?? Color.gray, borderWidth ?? 1
Call applyStyle with skipFont:true, skipPadding:true, skipCornerRadius:true, skipBorderWidth:true to avoid double-applying
Update .default config keyboard to include full values: font, padding, cornerRadius, borderColor, borderWidth
config.keyboard.padding = custom EdgeInsets is applied correctly
config.keyboard.borderColor = .blue renders blue border
config.keyboard.cornerRadius = 8 renders rounded border
config.keyboard.borderWidth = 0 renders no border
.default config produces visually identical result (padding 1/3, gray 1pt border, radius 3)
Tests pass
Typecheck passes
